content: BBC NEWS | Scotland | Unique character of medieval town

html body text table tbody tr td div div font span
content: The Royal Mile at the opening of the Scottish Parliament

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div span
content: The historic buildings of Edinburgh's Old Town help to mark it out as one of Europe's most beautiful and architecturally important cities.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: In 1995, the Old Town, along with the city's New Town, was designated a World Heritage Site by Unesco.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: That puts it in the same bracket as the Taj Mahal and the pyramids of Egypt.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: Of the 13 other World Heritage Sites in the UK, St Kilda and New Lanark are the only other Scottish sites with Bath the only other urban centre.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div table tbody tr td font div div span
content: Edinburgh, capital of Scotland since the 15th century, presents the dual face of an old city dominated by a medieval fortress and a new neo-classical city whose development from the 18th century onwards exerted a far-reaching influence on European urban planning

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div table tbody tr td font div div span
html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: In its listing, Unesco paid tribute to the Old Town's "many buildings of great significance".

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: It says the juxtaposition of the Old and New Towns is what "gives the city its unique character".

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The Old Town is dominated, like the city, by the castle on a crag which has been fortified since the Iron Age.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: It is the great streets lined with imposing buildings which sweep up to the castle, and the network of closes in between, which tourists flock to in their millions every year.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p b span
html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: One of these buildings, on Chambers Street, is Adam House, currently owned by the University of Edinburgh, and used for exhibitions and as a venue during the International Edinburgh Festival.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: Named after the Adam family of architects who shaped much of the Georgian New Town, it has suffered smoke damage.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The tenement buildings surrounding it date back to the early 16th century and formed the blueprint for classic Scottish housing.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: They were home to all levels of society in the capital.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div table tbody tr td font div div span
content: The Old Town with the castle behind

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div span
content: In the 17th century, the burgeoning city of Edinburgh was desperately short of space.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The rock on which the city had been established was surrounded on three sides by boggy ground, so the city fathers built up.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The wealthiest families would take one whole house but relatively rich merchants would live side-by-side with the poor crammed into sub-divided flats next door.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The Old Town was the buzzing hub of city life.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The Scottish Parliament met there until the Act of Union with the English in 1707 and well into the 18th century, the area was also the home of Scotland's law courts, learning and commerce.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: It is some of these old seven storey buildings in Chambers Street and the Cowgate which have been burning over-night.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p b span
html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: This area of the city now forms the route for walking tours and ghost walks because it played host to some of the city's most notorious characters.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: The Cowgate was the stalking ground of the infamous bodysnatchers, Burke and Hare, who dug up freshly-buried bodies from graveyards and plied them to medical students at the nearby Old Surgeon's Hall.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: Then, near the Lawnmarket by its junction with George VI Bridge, is Brodie's Close.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: This was named after a respectable craftsman, Francis Brodie, but it is his son William who has given his name to a nearby pub.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: In the 18th century, Deacon Brodie was by day a respectable member of the town council, but by night burgled his wealthy neighbours.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: He came to a sticky end in 1788 after an abortive raid on the Excise Office in the Royal Mile.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: Ironically, also an inventor, he was hanged on a scaffold which he himself had designed.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: In the 18th century, the development of the Georgian New Town led to "The Great Flitting" when the higher classes moved out of the stinking hole the Old Town had become to the new elegant squares across Princes Street.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font div p span
content: However, in recent decades, the Old Town has undergone a commercial and entertainment resurgence and was declared a conservation area with the creation of the Old Town Renewal Trust.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td font span span
html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td a span span
html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td span span
content: "Thick smoke and sparks swirled over the city centre"

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td a span span
content: Tom Monro, Lothian and Borders Fire Brigade

tag: html body text table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td span span
content: "It's been a very difficult, complex fire"
